issue.title: docs: readme: add plugins section to example

body:
This seems to happen because eslintrc creates a new object for each reference to a plugin:

https://github.com/eslint/eslintrc/blob/99adbac4fec25a50e466946833677351eb8794b9/lib/config-array-factory.js#L408-L413

When a file matches multiple config objects with plugin `"n"`, flat config rejects the config because it sees them as different plugins (or different versions of the same plugin):

https://github.com/eslint/eslint/blob/42bfbd7b7b91106e5f279a05f40c20769e3cd29f/lib/config/flat-config-schema.js#L271-L273
üëç I've confirmed it was fixed if returns the same object. will make a PR later.

issue.title: fix: normalizePlugin() returns the same object

repository.name: eslintrc
repository.description: The legacy ESLintRC config file format for ESLint

issue.body:
refs: https://github.com/eslint/eslint/issues/16277

no idea how to add a test for this, as the func is not exported. any suggestions?

issue.title: fix: Plugins should always use the same reference

repository.name: eslintrc
repository.description: The legacy ESLintRC config file format for ESLint

issue.body:
When loading a plugin the first time, we should create a normalized plugin object and then cache it to use later so every reference to the same plugin is represented by the same normalized plugin reference.

Refs eslint/eslint#16277
Closes #89
Closes #90

@aladdin-add @coderaiser

issue.title: fix: Upgrade eslintrc to stop redefining plugins

labels.name: triage
labels.description: An ESLint team member will look at this issue soon

labels.name: archived due to age
